person.persName: Samuel Beal Thomas (Elizabethtown, Hardin County, KY wealthy businessman, KY state legislator, and large-scale slaveholder )

body.p: Born in Frederick County, Maryland, son of Samuel Thomas. Moved to West Point, Hardin County, Kentucky in 1828. Hired as clerk in office of Edward P. Johnson, mail contractor. Then made road agent over Johnson's mail routes. About 1830, Thomas and others bought out Johnson's mail line. Became Hough, Carter & Thomas stage coach line. Until the completion of the Louisville and Nashville Railroad, in 1860, this stage and mail route controlled the major mail routes, mostly in Kentucky, Tennessee, and Alabama. Married Zorayda Young of West Point, KY, 19 Sep 1833. Thomas became one of the leading businessmen of Kentucky, both in his stage coach line and several other business ventures. And one of the first directors of the Louisville and Nashville Railroad, which he helped finance. Elected to the Lower House of the Kentucky State Legislature in 1863. Served two years. Also one of the largest slaveowners in his part of Kentucky. Enslaved 53 people, according to 1860 U.S. slave census schedules.
